content.title: Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural Research
content.details: The Scheme 'Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural Research' has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture (MoC) and other identified cultural institutions in the country, by encouraging Fellows/academicians to affiliate themselves with these institutions to work on projects of mutual interest. The scheme expects these Fellows/academicians to select specific resources of the institutions to use in their projects and take up research works that are related to the main objectives of these institutions.
benefits: Honorarium of ₹80,000/- per month for foreign fellows
House Rent Allowance of up to 30% of the honorarium
Contingency Grant up to ₹2.50 lakhs per annum for academic trips
Settling Allowance of ₹1.00 lakh for moving expenses
eligibility: At least 5 years of experience in research or performing arts
Impressive list of publications, including at least two monographs
Strong reputation in the field covered by the Nodal Institution
Open to both Indian and foreign nationals
content.application_process: Offline. Candidates must submit their application form to any one of the Nodal Institutions of their choice along with relevant documents.
documents_required: A write-up/synopsis of proposed research work
NoC (if a regular Central/State Govt. Employee)

faqs.question: What is the 'Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural Research' Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Scheme has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture (MoC) and other identified cultural institutions in the country, by encouraging Fellows/academicians to affiliate themselves with these institutions to work on projects of mutual interest.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Institutions under the Ministry of Culture, Government of India.

faqs.question: Who are eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Fellows who have sound academic or professional credentials and have made significant contributions to knowledge in their respective fields will be eligible to apply for Tagore National Fellowship.

faqs.question: What is the number of fellowships awarded annually?
faqs.answer: The scheme envisages the granting of up to 15 Fellowships in a year.

faqs.question: Can both Indian and foreign nationals apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Scheme will be open to both Indian and foreign nationals. However, the proportion of foreigners will not normally exceed one-third of the total fellowships awarded in a year.
